means: 经遗传获得（品质、身体特征等），继任

sentence.Network_en: The meek shall inherit the earth.
They are to inherit 100,000 US dollars.

细胞质遗传(cytoplasmic inheritance)也称核外遗传（extranuclear inheritance) 是指由细胞质(核外)的遗传物质所控.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English enherite 'receive as a right', from Old French enheriter, from late Latin inhereditare 'appoint as heir', from Latin in- 'in' + heres, hered- 'heir'

entry.def: If you inherit money or property, you receive it from someone who has died.

example.ex: He has no son to inherit his land.
example.tran: 他没有儿子来继承田产。

example.ex: ...paintings that he inherited from his father.
example.tran: 他从父亲那里继承来的油画

entry.def: If you inherit something such as a task, problem, or attitude, you get it from the people who used to have it, for example because you have taken over their job or been influenced by them.

example.ex: The government inherited an impossible situation from its predecessors...
example.tran: 这届政府从前任那里接过了一个非常棘手的烂摊子。

example.ex: Our legal system inherited laws from the English system.
example.tran: 我们的司法体系沿袭了英国的法律体系。

entry.tran: 经遗传获得(特征、特质等)
entry.def: If you inherit a characteristic or quality, you are born with it, because your parents or ancestors also had it.

example.ex: We inherit from our parents many of our physical characteristics...
example.tran: 我们的许多身体特征都是从父母那里遗传而来的。

example.ex: Her children have inherited her love of sport...
example.tran: 她的孩子们继承了她对运动的热爱。

means.word_mean: 1. obtain from someone after their death;

sentences.sentence: "I inherited a castle from my French grandparents"
"The new chairman inherited many problems from the previous chair"
"I inherited my good eyesight from my mother"

auth_sentence.content: You do not inherit according to a civilian law.
auth_sentence.res_content: You do not inherit according to a civilian law.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You do not inherit according to a civilian law.

auth_sentence.content: That way, his daughter will inherit more money.
auth_sentence.res_content: That way, his daughter will inherit more money.

Sentence.sentence: Her father died when she was 21 and she inherited 7.
She inherited a big fortune from her father

The result could be a group of young people that, like their boomer (二战后生育高峰期出生的美国人) parents, grows up with a strong sense of purpose and sheds the image of apathy (冷漠) they've inherited from Generation X (60 .代后期和70 .代出生的美国人).

sentences.en: If he dies without making a will, his closest relative will inherit.
sentences.cn: 如果他没有立下遗嘱就去世了, 他的至亲将成为其继承人。

sentences.en: He intended that his son should inherit his business.
sentences.cn: 他打算让他的儿子继承他的生意。

jushi.english: If he dies without making a will, his closest relative will inherit.
jushi.chinese: 如果他没有立下遗嘱就去世了,他的至亲将成为其继承人。

jushi.english: He intended that his son should inherit his business.
jushi.chinese: 他打算让他的儿子继承他的生意。

jushi.english: He mused over what he would do if he were suddenly to inherit a million dollars.
jushi.chinese: 他胡思乱想如果他忽然继承了100万美元,他会怎么办。
